There are definitely more nutritious snacking options than this assortment of biscuits. But there‚Äôs a reason you‚Äôve heard of all (or most of) these items. It is unequivocally because people enjoy consuming them. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Therefore, instead of assuming biscuits are nutritionally deadly, we are better placed to understand their relationship inclusive of our overall nutritional compass. A compass that includes balance of micronutrients, optimal energy intake for one‚Äôs needs and satisfaction. Additionally, to simply appreciate that a biscuit tastes good, but that it is accounted for should composition goals be at your helm.
‚Å£
That said, it is easy to see how consumption of multiple biscuits in short periods of time can quickly contribute to excessive caloric consumption. For example; consuming 6 chocolate digestives in one day (which takes a combined total of 250 seconds), adds 510 calories to one‚Äôs daily intake. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Though this can be facilitated, it is a large chunk of most individual‚Äôs daily energy intake. Being aware of lower calorie choices which allow us to consume similar portion sizes means that one does not have to change learned behaviour as such, but instead strategically supports their energy intake better.‚Å£
‚Å£
Understand that whilst there are more nutritious snacking options such as fruit and nuts, biscuits can absolutely be a valid option if the overall diet is universally supportive of it‚Äôs respective elements. The key driver is awareness and adherence to ensure that progress is always possible. üç™ ‚Å£
‚Å£
Which one is your favourite??? -‚Å£
-‚Å£
‚Å£
#biscuits #calories #snack #flexibledieting #oreo #treat #balanceddiet #nutritioncoach #caloriedeficit #fatlosstips #biscuitlove #snacking #dietplan #cookies #diet

Today I became a published author with my first book called Eat What You Like & Lose Weight For Life. You can buy it now using the link in my bio üìó.‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
When I began posting on Instagram five years ago, few listened or cared. Back then, the idea of being an author of one of the largest publishing houses in the world would have been as nonsensical as an avid vegan savaging a sirloin steak. And being the highest pre ordered title of 2019 for one of their main imprints would have seemed even more absurd. But both have happened. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
I‚Äôve had a lot to say about this, at times, woeful fitness industry we experience. And it turns out that it‚Äôs a fairly majestic feeling to empower people with the tools that allow them to make their own informed decisions regarding their diet.‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
So here it is, my book. You can understand the simple science behind fat loss, ignore fad diets, debunk nutrition myths/misconceptions, improve your relationship with food and utilise it‚Äôs many easy recipes. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
It is an evidence based resource empowering you to eat what you like, achieve your goals and believe in yourself for the rest of your life. It‚Äôs time to take back control from diet culture and industry agendas that rob you of your self esteem. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Many have criticised me for not monetising my Instagram account. But, despite coming from a fairly humble financial background, I have never been tempted by any offer. You may have realised by now that every single image and word that I post is hugely important to me, because it could ultimately be hugely important to you. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Thus, I‚Äôm happy to promote the sh*t out of my book. Not just because it represents everything I stand for, but because I believe it‚Äôs contents could change your life forever. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Thank you for the support I‚Äôve received so far. I am forever grateful to you all. I truly mean that. üôè‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
A wise man once said that success is not final, failure is not fatal: it‚Äôs the courage to continue that counts. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
And continue with courage we shall... üéà ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
@eburybooks‚Å£‚Å£
-‚Å£‚Å£
-‚Å£‚Å£
#thefitnesschef #nutritioncoach #flexiblediet #newbook #authorlife #caloriecounting #eatsmart #diettips #diet #eatwell #easyrecipes #foodfacts

Scrooge spent one of his many Christmas eve‚Äôs uncharismatically traipsing through Victorian London, snarling at any soul who wished to embrace the ‚Äòholiday spirit‚Äô. He loathed the warmth, lack of productivity and pointless generosity that Christmas proposed. And on Christmas Eve, instead of enjoying seasonal foods and drinks with loved ones, he retired to his cold, dark drawing room in front of a heartless fire, eating blocks of sweaty cheese in horrendously unflattering pyjamas and a foosty bed hat.‚Å£
‚Å£
What Scrooge didn‚Äôt realize (along with many people in 2019), is that Christmas is about joy, generosity and eating and drinking as you please. Additionally, a merry Christmas is losing touch with the status quo, temporarily forgetting nutritional goals for a few days in order to focus on family and friends. Whatever becomes of your food intake as a result of the main festive experience is unimportant.‚Å£
‚Å£
Christmas is about being able to flick a reassuring informed switch that a few days non-adherence to the nutrition goal out of 365 will not harm the long term success of it. And after indulgence has been had, one can then calmly flick the switch back on to resume adherence to a controlled, enjoyable diet and lifestyle which supports their compositional aspirations. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Ebineezer Scrooge required a series of haunting ghosts to change his mindset about Christmas. Perhaps this post is all you need to realise that for just a few days, you can relent your health and fitness aspirations and focus on indulgence and nutritional relaxation. All the while with steely confidence that you will transition back into the norm very soon.‚Å£
‚Å£
Merry Christmas to the best group of followers on social media. It‚Äôs time to get off of Instagram for a day or two to spend that precious time with the ones you love. Best wishes to you and your family. Graeme xü§òüéÑ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
#christmas #christmasfood #festive #eatsmart #christmaspudding #diettips #christmastime #nutritioncoach #flexibleseating #flexiblediet #xmasfood #christmasdinner #foodfreedom #eatwhatyoulike #festivedrinks

One could literally consume the entirety of a small selection box (comprised of 5 items) for virtually the same caloric and sugar value of a single Starbucks gingerbread latte. Additionally, the former is likely to be split over days, (or at least hours), whilst the latter will be consumed in a matter of minutes. ‚Å£
‚Å£
As I stated earlier this week, Christmas is not about accurately dialing in one‚Äôs nutrition in strict format. It is about being lenient and flexible to allow for happy, sociable times which are normally centred around friends, family, food and drinks. Thus, this comparison is not to strike fear into a Christmas spirited individual. Instead it is to provide perspective. ‚Å£
‚Å£
However, this doesn‚Äôt mean that an individual must always be void of all nutritional awareness over the festive period if they don‚Äôt wish to. This is also a dogmatic attitude. ‚Å£
‚Å£
What this graphic may do is validate allowance for an individual to consume a selection box consisting of 458 calories - if that is what they want to do. Or better yet, empower an individual to decide to consume a chocolate bar for far less calories. Or perhaps inform one about a 472 calorie drink that can be enjoyed, or repacked by a different drink with a different caloric worth. Perhaps this graphic will inform an individual to regress from either option - to to embrace both options if enjoyment is to be had.‚Å£
‚Å£
Whatever the outcome of your nutritional decisions over the festive period, remember that there is always time to optimise progress after Ho Ho Ho, Home Alone 2, After Eights, turbulent Christmas parties and arguments over Christmas dinners. üéÖ ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
‚Å£
#starbucks #latte #gingerbreadlatte #coffee #christmasfood #caloriecounting #coffeebreak #christmastreat #chocolatelover #flexiblediet #eatwhatyoulike #chocolate #christmaschocolate #coffeelover

The shaming of dietary choices in 2019 is rife. These shamings are usually void of any meaningful context and at times spearheaded by those in positions of nutritional authority. Forever catapulting assumptive rhetoric without appreciating overall food intakes over periods of time.‚Å£
‚Å£
If these food ‚Äòshamers‚Äô did apply perspective each time they lambasted an individual for eating a morsel of chocolate mousse, or pasta, or macaroni cheese, or pizza, or skittles, or shreddies, or any food, they would understand the following:‚Å£
‚Å£
The presence of sugar in food is not a problem - it is the quantity and regularity of consumption which may be of relevant to one‚Äôs health. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Satiety is subjective. Furthermore, we literally have the mental capacity to choose not to continue eating food. Therefore it is not down to the food, it is down to us. ‚Å£
‚Å£
If perspective is applied, it‚Äôs likely that moderate intake of saturated fat is less harmful to our health than inhaling petrol fumes and other unappreciated health inhibitors. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Most foods are processed to a point. It is a better idea to understand the nutritional properties of the actual ingredients before labelling food as bad just because it‚Äôs processed. ‚Å£
‚Å£
All foods contain chemicals. The danger arrives in the dose. Apple seeds contain cyanide (a lethal poison), but the dose in apple seeds is too small to become lethal.‚Å£
‚Å£
And because the term ‚Äòempty calories‚Äô is a contradiction of basic science. As a calorie is a unit of energy, it literally exists as that and cannot be empty. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Persistent criticism of food without any contextual explanation regarding overall diet, lifestyle or portion size/regularity displays a lack of understanding education and empathy. Additionally, enforcement of nutritional perfection (which doesn‚Äôt exist) may negatively affect one‚Äôs mental relationship with food. ‚Å£
‚Å£
We are all best placed to eradicate such negative, unfounded influences from our day to day life. If useful knowledge is present, demonisation of food does not accompany it. üôÇ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£ #nutritioncoach #flexiblediet #mealprep #mealplan #sugar #caloriecontrol #flexibleeating #eatwell #fatlosstips #dieting #carbsarelife #mentalhealth

When you look back at your life, there is a very strong possibility that the moments you remember most will not involve logging food or completing a training session.‚Å£
‚Å£
Despite overall adherence to both being important in that they can bring the fruits of happiness, comfort and confidence in one‚Äôs skin over time, some moments arrive on very few occasions.‚Å£
‚Å£
Being present with the ones you love during important times (like Christmas) may include eating more food, foregoing exercise and getting drunk, all to the temporary detriment to your fitness goal, but not to the moments you will cherish most when you recall the meaningful events in your life.‚Å£ Thus, one can enrich their life by including such moments.
‚Å£
When you‚Äôre 80 years old you‚Äôll remember fondly the time you and your friends passionately (though disastrously) disturbed the neighbours singing a 7 renditions of Sweet Caroline - with glasses of champagne and canap√©s in hand. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Or the time you saw Rob pee on the photocopier at the office Christmas party - watching on with 4 sausage rolls [insert joke here].‚Å£
‚Å£
Or that festive period that you were so hungover most days that you forgot to take your training kit to work. But also that one of the nights out aligned you with your future husband/wife. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Or the Christmas you couldn‚Äôt go to the gym much because you took your children to Christmas amusements, watching their excitement whilst eating waffles, ice cream and pizza. Times they remembered indefinitely. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Or that precious time you spent with a loved one no longer here - which included significant surpassing of your calorie target that day. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Adherence to your fitness goal is important. But sacrificing optimal progress for a couple of weeks in order to create memories that mean more is more important.
‚Å£
Because progress can wait. And because more meaningful moments cannot. So recognise them. And for gods sake, live them. ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
‚Å£
#christmas #festivefood #theholidays #christmasfitness #fitforchristmas #christmasfood #familytime #eatwhatyoulove #nightouttfit #flexibledieting #balanceddiet

The differentiation between good and bad is one of the vaguest questions known to man. Both eventualities are ultimately quantified by a long list of personal traits and variables. ‚Å£
‚Å£
When it comes to nutrition, the meaningless concept of good and bad continues, except here it can go under the extraordinary alias of ‚Äòclean and dirty‚Äô. In this example, we have 2 breakfasts; one is cloned to ‚Äòclean eating‚Äô instagram royalty, whilst the other is rendered as an episode of insurmountable shame. The former mirrors a wellness blogger‚Äôs sensationalized documentation of a nutrient dense meal. The latter fails to be recognized a legitimate meal at all. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Naturally, given that some wellness bloggers have outstanding physiques. Followers will attempt replicate all facets of their idol‚Äôs life, including what they eat - or what they tell you they eat anyway...‚Å£
‚Å£
But then... when little progress is made and the follower constantly looks at said blogger‚Äôs candid 15% body fat photos, they become demotivated. Followers can not fathom why, despite following all advice, they do not look like their idol. It‚Äôs probably because the wellness blogger (despite practicing it themselves) has not educated their followers on basic energy balance - instead focusing entirely on the benefits of elevated nutrient consumption.‚Å£
‚Å£
Whilst the granola bowl and the McDonald‚Äôs breakfast are nutritionally different, neither are good or bad. Instead, their isolated effect on one‚Äôs health is decided by their affinity with many other variables. Despite the wishy washy annotations about ‚Äònourishing body and soul‚Äô, one would be better served to look objectively. Then, despite it being more likely to satiate, this nutrient dense granola bowl and green juice amounts to 929 calories. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Energy balance is the only nutritional strand which directly defines body composition. Therefore, notwithstanding the importance of overall nutritional vigilance, make sure you at least include it in your thoughts. üôÇ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
#fatloss #mcdonalds #mcmuffin #healthybreakfast #nutritioncoach #nutrients #wellness #smoothiebowl #brunch #maccies #eggmcmuffin

Whilst my heading is technically misleading in that alcohol as a single organic compound can never be ‚Äòlow calorie‚Äô, common reference to alcoholic drinks will always be done so through the term ‚Äòalcohol‚Äô. For those pedantic nutritionists/scientist out there, this post should probably go under the alias of ‚Äòlow calorie drinks containing alcohol‚Äô. But you‚Äôd fall asleep before completing the heading... So f*ck that. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Alcohol is a macronutrient like protein, carbohydrate and fat, but it‚Äôs not required for survival. It contains 7 calories per gram to be exact. Given it‚Äôs calorie density, it‚Äôs easy to understand how alcohol related calorie consumption can accumulate.‚Å£
‚Å£
The absence of nutritional value from these calories means that no potential behavioural benefits arise from its consumption (apart from the ability to turn in to a courageous sleaze or superstar DJ). Though there is evidence to suggest that the thermogenic response during alcohol digestion is around 20% of total calories. However, considering the intricacies of TEF with regard to alcohol usage is pretty futile when you‚Äôre 12 deep at 3am, dragging you legs along the pavement with ripped jeans, one shoe and an imminently collapsing kebab.‚Å£
‚Å£
If fat loss or maintenance is the goal over the festive period, surely it‚Äôs worth considering drinks which taste the same/very similar, but have a reduced caloric worth. In most cases, the alcohol density remains the same, but changes to additional ingredients lower the overall calorie value. ‚Å£
‚Å£
This way you can still socialise rampantly over Christmas. But also continue getting closer to your fitness goal at the same timeüî•.‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
#alcohol #nightoutfit #nightoutonthetown #nightoutwithfriends #calories #caloriescount #caloriecounting #dietplan #drinking #beer #wine #vodka #festivedrinks #xmasdrinks #christmasdrinks #officechristmasparty #cocktails

This morning I was invited onto BBC 2 to discuss the new, proposed ‚Äòpace‚Äô food labelling, designed show customers how much exercise they require to burn the calories from foods they consume in an attempt to improve obesity rates. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Naturally, I accepted the offer. But unfortunately a less than adequate Skype connection put pay to some of my thoughts being aired on national television... so here they are.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
The most glaring problem with these labels is that we all have different energy expenditures. Thus, the assumption that it takes 1 hour for everyone to burn 588 calories of chocolate is simply incorrect.
‚Å£‚Å£
Secondly, around 70% of the calories we burn each day are done so from a state of rest (BMR). Thus, one does not necessarily need to burn off the food they consume through exercise. This notion that mandatory exercise is required after eating food may lead to demonization of food or viewing exercise as punishment. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
The reality is that total energy in vs out over time is the critical pathway to enjoyed compositional management. Not believing you need to run for 48 minutes after eating some sweets. Or worse, being fearful to eat the sweets in the first place. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Thirdly, the evidence which produced results in favour of ‚ÄòPACE‚Äô labels referenced a small sample of studies in a controlled lab. This does not account for mass human behaviors in uncontrolled environments.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Lastly, present food labelling already displays relevant, useful information. Thus, the current labelling is not to blame for rising obesity. Our basic understanding and ambivalence to education, socio economic status and sedentary lifestyles is. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
The intent for change is noted, but the fruits of the intent are not only irrelevant and factually incorrect, but also diminish positive relationships with food.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£
Understanding ones total daily energy requirements for fat loss and adhering to a calorie deficit is not only a simpler intervention, but it is relevant to everyone. üëä‚Å£‚Å£
-‚Å£‚Å£
-‚Å£‚Å£
#caloriedeficit #foodlabels #obesity #caloriecontrol #nutritioncoach #caloriecounting #nutritionfacts #fatlosstips #losefat #exercise #diet #dieting #chocolate #nutritionist

Tag a mate, hit save and stay informed on these festive snacks as Christmas draws closer.‚Å£
‚Å£
Whilst it is the time of year when one needs to recognize the need for joyful socializing, it doesn‚Äôt mean that one‚Äôs nutrition goals need to be completely abandoned. Sanctioning festive treats to the realms of calorie control may appear Scrooge-like, but partaking in several gluttonous snacking orgy‚Äôs for weeks without any active appreciation of calories consumed may result in the birth of a January Scrooge instead. Or worse, a prompt to select a disastrous fad diet.‚Å£
‚Å£
That said, it isn‚Äôt often that one can enjoy a gingerbread man, a mince pie, pigs in blankets or festive drinks. Therefore one must consume them if they are enjoyed. For these festive time are what will be remembered, not whether you made totalitarian headway with your nutrition goals for 3 weeks each December.‚Å£
‚Å£
That said, instead of burying one‚Äôs head in the sand ‚Äòbecause it‚Äôs Christmas‚Äô, one can still enjoy such food/drinks alongside at least partial awareness of the accompanying nutritional information of that energy source.‚Å£
‚Å£
Then, when January 1 arrives, one can reflect on an enjoyable month where treats were eaten and alcohol was drunk, with neither indulgence violently regressing their fitness goal. ü§úü§õ‚Å£
‚Å£
Have I missed your favourite Christmas snack? I may need to do a second edition... üéÑ ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
#christmasfood #snacking #christmassnacks #mincepies #chocolate #qualitystreet #fatlosstips #nutritionfacts #nutritioncoach #merrychristmas #mulledwine #eggnog #fatlosscoach #toffeenutlatte #cake #christmastime

It‚Äôs a winters evening in 1996. Peter‚Äôs father is at home watching prime time Saturday night television. He marvels at Noel‚Äôs House Party. And then the national lottery results delivered by the incomparable Bob Monkhouse.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
A glance to the kitchen table - and there it is. The evening snack. Two timid rice cakes. They sit in sadness, awaiting their intestinal doom. Lining up to be entrenched into a dry mouth and chewed sadly for 3615 seconds before entry into an esophagus desperate for excitement. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
A glance inside the fridge - and there that is. Tomorrow‚Äôs breakfast. 1/2 a grapefruit. It cunningly sits in silence, smirking at its suppression of morning glories for years, instead inflicting palatable torture on its host. No need for tissues...‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
An opening of a cupboard - and there it was. The space where the snickers bars once lay. Only now, replaced by dust and apple cider vinegar. They reside in consummate silence. They know they have won.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Thirty four years have passed. A winters evening in 2030. Now 60 years old, Peter‚Äôs dad is awaiting the winner of I‚Äôm a celebrity. He casts a glance towards his rice cakes. He opens the fridge door. And he looks inside the cupboard with a final nod of acceptance. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
He sits back in his chair and he remembers Raquel. That voluptuous brunette from California that he met on holiday in 1994. The one who tried to seduce him in a public lagoon. The most beautiful woman he had ever seen. He contorts as he recalls his dismissive rebuff of her seduction in the name of being a law abiding citizen. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
And now it is. Peter has finally realized that whilst optimal health is important, he has missed out on countless enjoyable moments in his life because of his extreme beliefs. He looks out his passport. ‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
He arrives at the airport wearing a t-shirt saying ‚Äòzero f*cks given here‚Äô. He clutches a small bag containing cookies, viagra and a snickers bar in one hand, a walking stick and condoms in the other. He is on his way to California..üéà‚Å£‚Å£
-‚Å£‚Å£
-‚Å£‚Å£
#balanceddiet #flexiblediet #snacking #enjoylife #flexibleeating #macros #cleaneating #christmastreats #liveyourbestlife #eatsmarter #diet #dietingtips #newdiet #diets

Whilst following weight watchers may improve a diet low in quality ingredients, it would also base your dietary foundation on nutritionally intergalactic mechanisms that mean nothing scientifically.‚Å£
‚Å£
Whilst calories are involved in the fundamentals of WWs ‚Äòsmart points‚Äô system, it over complicates the very simple energy balance equation. Instead of weight watchers spending money on trademarking their preposterous ‚Äòzero foods‚Äô which aren‚Äôt to be ‚Äòweighed, measured or tracked‚Äô, they would be better placed employing evidence based nutrition coaches who do not stand for such nonsense. ‚Å£
‚Å£
People will succeed on weight watchers. But only if in a state of caloric deficit. WW does provide a mechanism of structural adherence, but unless you plan on enrolling into WW for the rest of your life, you‚Äôre going to have to understand nutritional fact and control eventually. And once you do, WW will be weeping at your departure from a system which is designed to create a dependency by means of non-education.‚Å£
‚Å£
Smart points? Just track calories and understand basic macronutrients on food labels and the multitude of apps available online. Zero point foods? These foods still contain f*cking calories. This lack of basic knowledge is why people move sideways instead of forwards. Every week being told by unqualified ‚Äòexperts‚Äô that they‚Äôve succeeded or failed based on entirety of body weight, which measures more than body fat.
‚Å£
People who do not succeed at losing fat on WW do not fail at losing fat - they fail at WW. A mechanism void of objective, informed, empowering and applicable information.‚Å£
‚Å£
Understanding basic caloric/macro quantities of food, calculating a gradual caloric deficit, regular exercise, increasing NEAT and access to evidence based material are the things that adherence to change can be built on. Not a technically condescending system which creates misinformed dependence and drags us further away from the basic information needed to transform our lives. üî•‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
#dieting #diettips #weightwatchers #fatlosstips #nutritioncoach #flexibledieting #smartpoints #eatsmart #newdiet #caloriecontrol #flexibledieting #nutritionist #caloriecounter #countcalories

Grasping the relationship between energy consumed and the end goal can only be realized if there is consistent awareness of eating behaviours. And this includes ridding ourselves of presumption and replacing it with relative perspective and addressing what is important.‚Å£
‚Å£
For example, this weekly selection of generous, yet normalized allotments of side sauces accumulate to 1135 calories. The assumption is that the caloric value consumed during each episode is small enough to omit from our nutritional reckoning. But whilst the values are individually small, over time small can become relatively large. Much like pennys make pounds. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Another assumption may be that consuming a ferociously calorie dense Domino‚Äôs pizza will require diligent tracking to the utmost. If compositional goals are in play, diligent tracking of calorie dense items is of course wise, but they should be held in the same perspectives of all calories consumed. Because all food is equal in that we should allow ourselves access to any food we enjoy. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Yet we often have a disconnect between assumption and reality. Assumption leads one to believe that regular, small amounts of sauce are too insignificant to be worthy of consideration. But that an irregular pizza may ruin the hard yards of dieting, such is its caloric density. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Though sauces and moderated pizzas should always be eaten if enjoyed, if perspective is applied, we can see above that the assumed threat to one‚Äôs composition (pizza) is in fact more favourable than the assumed insignificance (sauces). ‚Å£
‚Å£
As ever, the point here revolves around awareness. Awareness that certain eating patterns may facilitate or inhibit progress. Awareness that all food is allowed. Awareness that quantity of calories, not type of food, is the direct driver regarding compositional change. And awareness that, over time, small dietary change as a result of basic knowledge can reap big rewards. üî•‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
‚Å£
#pizza #pizzanight #dominos #dieting #fatloss #nutrition #losefat #calories #caloriedeficit #flexiblediet #dominospizza #weightlosstips #ketchup #caloriecontrol #dinnertime

We are regularly reminded that we should consume 10 portions of fruit and vegetables each day. 
Most research clearly associates higher micronutrient consumption with reduction in onset of disease (though not cure of existing disease) and improvement in basic health markers. Thus, building the foundations of one‚Äôs diet on abundances of fruit and vegetables (and whole foods in general) provides a greater chance of long term optimal health.

Within the research, there are also correlations between higher ratios of whole food consumption and lower body fat, compared to refined foods and higher body fat. 
This is not because refined foods inherently make us fat - know that any enjoyed food can (and must) be eaten, regardless of its nutritional entity. Because the aforementioned is likely down to many other combined efforts to lead an overall lifestyle conducive to calorie control vs not. Not least inclusive of exercise. 
But contrary to our governments vague dialogue regarding ‚Äòhealthy eating‚Äô (whatever that is), achieving a desired body composition may not occur by simply choosing nutritious foods. The answer is more advanced, but nonetheless simple. 
As my graphic shows, patting oneself on the back for achieving 10 portions of fruit & veg each day, regardless of caloric value, may not be enough if compositional interests/changes are on the agenda. 
Though the presence of fibre may influence satiety, when referring to composition, one may be best placed to appreciate the caloric worth of any given food as just that. Whether it is an avocado, broccoli or a donut. By doing so, nutrients are still consumed, but caloric consumption can easily reduce/increase in accordance with goals.

By understanding that nutrients and energy operate as separate nutritional entities within the same foods, one can realise both are just as important if an optimal diet/lifestyle is to be achieved. But above all, do it with calm. üôè
-
-
#freshfruit #fruit #vegetables #vegan #veggie #nutritious #berries #healthysnack #eatsmart #fibre #caloriecounting #nutritionist #loseweight #losefat #diet #dietplan

As the clock strikes 8, the dust settles on another day of intermittent fasting for many. An eating strategy designed entirely around the chronology of time focused eating windows. And often used as an intended weight loss intervention. ‚Å£
‚Å£
One method coined ‚Äò16:8‚Äô proposes a fasted state for 16 hours, leaving 8 hours for the accumulation of one‚Äôs entire daily food intake - usually between 10-6 or 12-8.‚Å£
‚Å£
And though some individual studies report weight loss benefits under the jurisdiction of IF, such advantages do not triumph over energy restriction (calorie deficit). Instead, one can surmise that these results occur because of reduction in allowed eating times may have inadvertently reduced total calories consumed. ‚Å£
‚Å£
One is definitely better placed to consult analysis of the literature in the form of systematic reviews, or meta analysis. In doing so, a balanced appraisal of many studies can be analysed to provide a nigh on definitive outcome. ‚Å£
‚Å£
In a recent meta analysis by Harris et al in 2018, they compared intermittent fasting energy restriction vs continuous/regular energy restriction as interventions for treatment of obesity in adults. They concluded that whilst both interventions achieved reduction in bodyweight, that there was no significant difference in weight loss between the two.‚Å£
‚Å£
To conclude, if you enjoy eating breakfast or late night meals/snacks and you want to lose weight, you can. And if you enjoy foregoing breakfast or late night meals/snacks and you want to lose weight, you can. Therefore, IF can be an effective tool alongside calorie restriction (pending personal preference), but without energy restriction it is a redundant intervention for weight loss. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Put simply, IF zealots who reference average evidence as confirmation to their fantastical belief that IF holds more weight loss advantages than regular caloric restriction are wrong by virtue of current evidence. And they should probably stop arguing about it. üôÇ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£

The point of consuming food is to remain alive. The point of controlling our intake of food is to manage our physique and overall health. The point of consuming fewer calories is to reduce body fat across our composition. But one constant in all of the above should be our enjoyment of the food we eat.

When an individual embarks on fat loss each of the above are important. One must enjoy their energy consumption, be aware of energy intake in relation to their energy output, and consistently ensure that they are in a state of caloric deficit. To ensure progress, one may have to change and adjust their dietary habits. But instead of completely radicalising the diet, adherence to change may be more likely if one makes subtle changes over time. For example: consuming the same volume of lower calorie foods and drinks that replicate higher the calorie versions in experience.

This graphic shows two groups of foods/drinks. One group contains over double the calorie amount of the other, yet quantities of both remains the same (apart from the freddo). Crucially, the lower calorie versions resemble similar palatable offerings as their higher calorie counterparts.

Whilst consumption of lower calorie versions may not be immediately significant, they can be over a period of time. For example, if one swapped daily consumption of 300ml of whole milk for semi skimmed milk for 1 year, they would consume 17520 fewer calories whilst the ‚Äòmilk experience‚Äô is minimally compromised.

We must make such choices with the knowledge that lower calorie items may contain less of a particular macronutrient. And in the case of low calorie beverages, awareness that sweeteners are included. 
Losing fat is not straightforward. It requires habit change. But if an individual recognizes opportunities to make small changes which reap handsome, long term rewards, it‚Äôs seems short sighted not to take them. üî•

We like to idolize and demonize most things. We crave affirmation that what we believe in is universally correct. An example can easily be found in those idolizing their favourite sports team, whilst demonizing that team‚Äôs bitter rival. Yet, if put into non-emotional, neutral context, both teams are merely trying to beat each other by the same means.‚Å£
‚Å£
We idolize some foods because we believe them to be ‚Äòbetter‚Äô for us - we want affirmation that our consumption is correct. We demonize other foods because we believe they are ‚Äòworse‚Äô for us - we want affirmation that consuming these foods is incorrect. But in isolation, no food is correct or incorrect, it‚Äôs just different. ‚Å£
‚Å£
In this example we have avocado on brown bread and Nutella on white bread. The former is often idolized, whilst the latter is usually demonised or associated with guilt. Yet in this example, consumption of the former means enjoyment, more nutrients and fibre, but also more calories. Whereas consumption of the latter means enjoyment, less nutrients and fibre, but in this example, significantly fewer calories.‚Å£
‚Å£
Therefore the avocado toast may be a good idea if the goal is to consume more nutrients and potentially enhance satiety, but the Nutella toast may support calorie reduction. These outcomes ultimately depend on overall dietary intake. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Sometimes our unwillingness to consider what we don‚Äôt believe in (known as confirmation bias) take us away from what is actually true. Believing foods to be good or bad without inserting overall context is to digress from what matters most. Eating any food should be an enjoyable process. But it should be done in a place where feelings of ‚Äògood or bad‚Äô are replaced with understanding, reality and ease. ‚Å£
‚Å£
When a sports team scores a goal against our team, the other supporters celebrate whilst we are in despair. But the neutral supporter appreciates the goal for its non-emotional worth. Our beliefs in food should be no different. üî•‚Å£

One of the most frequently asked questions regarding stagnation/reversal of weight loss is whether or not one is in the precarious state of ‚Äòstarvation mode‚Äô.‚Å£
‚Å£
The term (and those who coined it) claim that if one‚Äôs caloric intake is very low, that our metabolism defies the simple equation of energy balance to halt fat reduction and to protect our anatomy from literal starvation. The theory goes as far to claim the this state may also create a state of protective increased fat storage. But the explanation is a little different and requires greater clarity. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Instead, there are many reasons why weight loss unexpectedly slows down or reverses - and they all rather poetically result in one simply not being in a state of caloric deficit. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Under appreciation of calories consumed can lead one to believe they are in a caloric deficit, when simply, they are not. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Perceived movement and exercise can lead one to believe they are burning more calories than they actually are. Whilst there is adherence to regular exercise, less energy as a result of caloric deficiency may result in less calories being burned. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Additionally, miscalculation of one‚Äôs calorie amount or failing to adjust calorie intake/energy expenditure as weight decreases may result in one no longer being in a state of caloric deficit. ‚Å£
‚Å£
If the caloric deficit has been particularly aggressive, metabolic adaptation may occur to affect resting energy expenditure. Therefore, energy expenditure predicted by online calculators may be different from what is required. As a result, weight may increase or weight loss may be slower than expected. ‚Å£
‚Å£
To conclude, there is no metabolic ‚Äòstarvation mode‚Äô magic. Only actual starvation and non starvation. The Minnesota starvation experiment can swiftly provide reliable evidence in support of this. Body fat does not reduce if one is simply not in a state of caloric deficit, the reason for this is likely to be one of the above. üôè‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£

Whilst some may denounce animal based proteins as an unethical or ‚Äòcontaminated‚Äô food source, separation of scientific facts from emotional choice enables production factual nutritional representations, free from bias. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Adequate protein consumption has many proven benefits, whilst basing our diet on plant based protein instead is just as legitimate a choice.‚Å£
‚Å£
This post aims to discuss protein density/quality per food source. Foods with complete proteins are those which contain all essential, non reproductive amino acids in sufficient quantities. Food with incomplete proteins either don‚Äôt contain all essential amino acids or do not reach sufficient thresholds of them. ‚Å£
Regarding protein density, it is clear that (on the whole) animal based sources contain more protein per gram/calorie, making protein/calorie targets easier to achieve. It is also worth mentioning that the macronutrient components of animal based sources will include higher amounts of fat, whereas plant based sources will incorporate larger degrees of carbohydrates within the overall food.‚Å£
‚Å£
By consuming animal based foods an individual would be consuming a complete protein source with all essential amino acids. And whilst plant based foods are usually bereft of complete BCAA‚Äôs, their elevated micronutrient properties included make them an attractive proposition towards fulfilling functional health improvements. ‚Å£
‚Å£
We do not need to consume high amounts of protein if we don‚Äôt want to. But scientific research suggests that, despite the ferocity of some vegans and precaution over relative risk of processed meat consumption, that a diet rich in animal based protein can benefit our overall health.‚Å£
‚Å£
Then again, if one feels passionately about avoiding animal products for ethical/dietary reasons, they must do so. But probably in the knowledge that they may need to work harder to adhere to a diet rich in complete branch chain amino acids if that is critical to the goal. üôÇ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£

When consuming energy in a state of caloric deficit for fat loss, one can definitely increase the volume of food consumed. ‚Å£
‚Å£
There may be confusion over the popular dieting adage of, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm losing weight, but I‚Äôm eating more that ever before‚Äù regarding the false belief that consuming more calories will somehow elicit fat loss. ‚Å£
‚Å£
This notion is of course scientifically impossible. In scientific terms, an individual must be in a state of caloric deficit for weight loss to occur in the first instance. But by ‚Äòeating more than they ever have before‚Äô they have simply increased the volume of lower calorie foods across their overall dietary intake. Thus they are eating more total food, but fewer overall calories, resulting in adherence to a caloric deficit. ‚Å£
‚Å£
As a caloric deficit is the only way fat loss can occur, reducing caloric intake may be difficult for an individual seeking fat loss. Not least because there is a change in dietary habit and habitual satiety after feeding episodes. Therefore, it makes perfect sense to consume a relatively high volume of food in order to remain satiated and reduce risk of excessive calorie consumption. ‚Å£
‚Å£
This can be delivered to an individual via consumption of lower calorie foods which can be eaten in relatively high volume. Most fruits and vegetables exists as prime candidates to champion such strategic execution of a sustainable calorie deficit. Increase in movement should also be considered. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Calorie dense foods (including those with or without nutritional value) should be included as part of a moderated calorie deficit if enjoyed. But there should be realisation that excessive consumption will likely counter-attack the overall balance of energy over time. ‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£
‚Å£
There is no magical metabolic inferno which enables an individual to consume a greater volume of calories than before and lose fat. Instead, a greater volume of food may well be consumed, but such food will contain fewer overall calories than previously. üôÇ‚Å£
‚Å£
#calories #satiety #strawberries #lowcalorie #eatsmart #fatlosstips #peanutbutter #diettips #dietingtips #balanceddiet #nutritioncoach #caloriedeficit #losefat #diettips #fruit

Tag a bread lover, hit save and get educated on the calorie values of these assorted breads. ‚Å£
‚Å£
People eat bread. This largely occurs because people enjoy bread. In most cases it is not particularly nutrient dense, but that doesn‚Äôt mean it can‚Äôt be consumed with/without something that is nutrient dense. ‚Å£
‚Å£
For too long bread has been blamed for weight gain and stagnation of weight loss. Whilst bread is left on supermarket shelves by those convinced that it‚Äôs the reason they are fat, the real issue is of course that several multi-faceted issues/actions across one‚Äôs diet and lifestyle contribute to weight gain/not being able to lose weight. To attribute one food as the single cause of this complexity is short sighted.‚Å£
‚Å£
Most of the calories in bread originate from carbs in refined form (and we know how irrational people can be about refined carbs). But when an individual claims that relatively high carb foods are detrimental for one‚Äôs composition, they are misinformed. In fact, one recent study tested diets with free access to refined carbs compared with refined fats. It‚Äôs results indicated that more weight was gained over time with free access to refined fats, not carbs. This is just one study of course. ‚Å£
‚Å£
As you‚Äôll see, in terms of calories, white bread is similar to wholemeal and rye breads. Therefore you will not necessarily manage weight better by consuming brown bread, despite it being less refined. The only key nutritional difference is fibre. And whilst fibre may increase one‚Äôs satiety, attention must also be paid to additional food variables included in the form of fillings or spreads to gather a greater insight into total energy consumed and subsequent food behaviour. ‚Å£
‚Å£
If you enjoy bread, include it in your diet. If you don‚Äôt enjoy bread, don‚Äôt include it. But whatever your decision, make it in the knowledge that any food can be enjoyed as part of a balanced diet. üî•‚Å£
‚Å£
P.s. Which bread is your favourite?‚Å£

Supplement (noun) is ‚Äòa thing added to something else in order to complete or enhance it‚Äô‚Å£
‚Å£
Whilst it is impossible to appreciate the exact quantities of each nutrient in any given food, it would be interesting to gain insight into our general understanding regarding what foods contain which nutrients. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Because our only basic exposure to the wording of many nutrients lies within the health aisles of supermarkets/health shops where capsules, pills and powders are labelled per vitamin and mineral. For some who are told they require more of any given nutrient, this is the first place they may visit. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Of course, in some cases it is necessary to supplement increased doses of a nutrient where deficiency lies. But in most cases, we can acquire all of the nutrients we need from the food we eat. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Thus, supplementation is designed to enhance overall diet, not lay its foundations. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Fish oil capsules are not essential, not least because most offer minuscule EPA DHA %, but because one can source such oil from oily fish, which is also a source of protein. ‚Å£
‚Å£
There is no evidence that consuming BCAAs is more effective for building/preserving muscle tissue than consuming sufficient protein over the course of each day. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Fruit and vegetables are chewable, palatable pieces of energy which contain a multitude of micronutrients. They do not require water to in order to swallow. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Vitamin B12 is present abundantly in meat and fish. Unless you‚Äôre vegan, simply increasing consumption of these items will help negate this deficiency.‚Å£
‚Å£
And whilst vitamin D supplementation may be useful in countries where sunlight is periodically sparse, going in the sun is the most efficient way to acquire this vitamin. ‚Å£
‚Å£
To conclude, there is a place for accurate supplementation, but unless prescription of additional doses is necessary (administered by a doctor), one can source all the necessary nutrients they need from food. Besides, as we need to eat food anyway, it seems a more logical idea. ü§úü§õ‚Å£
-‚Å£

The point of this post is not to strike fear into those who love to slurp regular caramel macchiatos. Instead the point is to inform with use of perspective. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Though we refer to all of our coffee themed drinks as ‚Äòcoffee‚Äô, it is clear that one person‚Äôs preference compared to another‚Äôs may represent a monumentally different nutritional acquisition, especially over time. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Simply put, coffee in its purest form contains 0 calories, a caloric calculation over time is therefore redundantly pointless. But should consistent selection of calorie inclusive coffee related beverages be consumed multiple times per day in bids to ‚Äòwake up‚Äô, ‚Äòperk up‚Äô and enjoy a palatable drink, the caloric calculation may be significantly higher. And therefore, over time, an important dietary consideration.‚Å£
‚Å£
There is nothing wrong with consuming cappuccinos, lattes or caramel macchiatos. But if one is persistently bemoaning lack of progress regarding composition, reduction of such beverages offer a very easy opportunity to support a caloric deficit without upheaval of habitual eating habits. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Furthermore, selection of alternative coffee inclusive drinks at lower (or no) caloric cost can ensure that one still ‚Äògets their fill‚Äô of daily coffee whilst also getting more progress in their compositional goal.‚Å£
‚Å£
With greater the upheaval of one‚Äôs diet comes reduced chances of long term adherence. But with smaller upheaval comes greater chance of long term adherence. For fat loss, long term adherence is the catalyst in building meaningful, educated eating patterns that support incremental change over time.‚Å£
‚Å£
Whether it‚Äôs coffee, a biscuit or any given food, seemingly insignificant alternations to minuscule parts of overall diet are likely to be the tweaks that finally deliver significant results. But more importantly, make the results last forever. üôÇ‚Å£

Most medical professionals do outstanding work by advising, protecting and solving health related matters for underprivileged, vulnerable people. ‚Å£
‚Å£
But as nutrition is an extensively nuanced subject, others in positions of medical authority exploit this. They make extortionate sums of money by filling in such nuances with their own agenda. They claim that single foods can cure disease. Or that herbs can cure obesity. There is no evidence. ‚Å£
‚Å£
A meta analysis was conducted by Kim & Knesebeck in 2017 to define the relationship between firstly: income and obesity (obesity resulting from low income). And secondly: reverse causality (low income as a result of being obese). ‚Å£
‚Å£
The results clearly showed some statistically significant effects regarding low income leading to obesity, but consistent evidence that obese individuals are more likely to be exposed to low income. One reason being weight stigma.‚Å£
‚Å£
In more literature, there are connections between socio economic status and disease (cardiovascular in particular). But more research is needed. ‚Å£ ‚Å£
In contrast, there is no reasonable evidence, let alone meta analysis, supporting the claims of quack doctors who claim miracle foods are curative solutions to widespread, deep rooted physiological problems (which sometimes stem from social inequality). The same solutions that underprivileged populations may financially invest in. ‚Å£
‚Å£
The ‚Äòquack‚Äô message is easy to believe and nigh on impossible to disprove by the same token that one could argue that aliens exist because it‚Äôs not proven that they don‚Äôt. ‚Å£
‚Å£
The irony about honest, hard working populations being disadvantaged whilst lying, deceptive con artists reap financial reward (and thus access to better healthcare) is as sickening as it is unjust.‚Å£
‚Å£
Ignoring fanciful claims lies in education. Which again, comes at a disadvantage to those living on low income. Our lack of knowledge results in more opportunities for quacks to exploit us. ‚Å£
The solution depends on higher powers. But the discussion must continue. üôè‚Å£
-‚Å£
-‚Å£

Whilst magazine dietitians construct their self promoting and often ill advised articles about why sugar and hormones cause obesity, my page has reach new heights of simplicity with this post.‚Å£
‚Å£
This information appears somewhat dense in comparison to the grand, salubrious advice one may read in Cosmopolitan or Men‚Äôs Health. Yet whilst those column inches are filled with hypothetical concepts (which often by-pass relatability from which the reader can benefit), this post provides a simple, albeit effective solution to eating episodes excessive in calories. ‚Å£
‚Å£
The science behind our requirement to forsake moderation and consume a whole packet of food once it‚Äôs opened may be worth researching. But research aside, it is clear that we don‚Äôt want to stop because we simply enjoy the food we are eating. ‚Å£
‚Å£
There are of course many reduced calorie options than the calorie dense foods included in this graphic - but whilst it is wise to consult such foods, sometimes you just don‚Äôt want them. Sometimes you want pringles. And sometimes you want chocolate. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Therefore, rather than endure forced food swaps as a measure of your ultimate desire to get results (aka how much you want it), is there not a much simpler solution right in front of your eyes? Buy the same foods that you enjoy, but smaller. This way your cupboards will offer the same palatable experience without offering caloric extortion. ‚Å£
‚Å£
As media dietitians (not all) are advising us that we need to beware of food groups or reset our hormones via green tea, here is an elementary comparison between large packets of calorie dense foods vs their smaller counterparts. The additional golden nugget of information being encouragement to include higher volume, calorie sparse, nutritious foods at regular intervals to support satiety, caloric adherence and functional health. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Fat loss has an infinite amount of research behind it. But despite all the noise, it will always come back to self care of our energy balance. Remember that. üôÇ‚Å£
